data.title: ShaderMaterial VIEWPORT_SIZE causes rendering glitch
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Ubuntu 16.04.03 LTS
Godot 3.0 master (2c5fa0947d724c0dcb24643f692f7a9d686a5490)
Nvidia GTX 660 driver 375.66

**Issue description:**
Accessing VIEWPORT_SIZE in a spatial shader program causes a glitch in the rendering. Visually the glitch looks similar to https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/11698. I suspect they're related but I don't know if the fix for that bug also fixes this one. This is a minimal shader program that demonstrates the problem:

```
shader_type spatial;

void fragment() {
	float a = VIEWPORT_SIZE.x;
}
```

WITHOUT SHADER:
![screenshot-20170929-17 00 35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1168026/31040160-ba0d2e5c-a538-11e7-8815-1c6057e41fdf.png)

WITH SHADER:
![screenshot-20170929-17 00 58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1168026/31040163-c12b9fe8-a538-11e7-8238-6494485bd075.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Add a shader material that uses VIEWPORT_SIZE to a mesh

**Link to minimal example project:**
[shader-viewport-size-bug.tscn.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1345942/shader-viewport-size-bug.tscn.zip)

data.title: (2.1.4) Debug mouse-over variable value popup not working
data.body:
Operating system: Windows 8.1 64-bit
Godot version: Godot_v2.1.4-stable_win64

**Issue description:**
When I breakpoint a script, then try to hover over a variable, the value does not popup. It still works fine for me in 2.1.3 .

I get this error which may have something to do with it:
ERROR: ScriptEditorDebugger::_notification: Condition ' cmd.get_type<> != Variant::STRING ' is true
	AT: editor\script_editor_debugger.cpp:1126

**Steps to reproduce:**
Never works in 2.1.4 for me.
(I did just have to set debug host, which got randomly set to something else to get the debugger to work again. Not sure if its connected to the issue or not)

data.title: Grid color property in editor settings ignores alpha, doesn't update
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Ubuntu 16.04.03 LTS
Godot 3.0 master (2c5fa0947d724c0dcb24643f692f7a9d686a5490)
GTX 660 driver 375.66

**Issue description:**
Grid color property in editor settings doesn't allow alpha. If an alpha value is set other than 255 then the grid color widget shows ERROR.

The grid color in the 3D view does not change after changing the grid color. You have to exit the editor and restart for the change to take effect.

![screenshot-20170929-08 30 53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1168026/31023587-2d32a15c-a4f1-11e7-8c0a-c2f9778c59dc.png)

Maybe related to e2861a3b7cbf92ab018b75e330b10abc42463a6e?

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Open Editor settings
- Change Grid color
- Set alpha (A) to some value other than 255

data.title: Toon specular mode and Clearcoat display glitch
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Ubuntu 16.04.03 LTS
Godot 3.0 master (2c5fa0947d724c0dcb24643f692f7a9d686a5490)
Nvidia GTX 660, driver 375.66

**Issue description:**
Setting material Specular Mode to Toon and enabling Clearcoat causes a display glitch (screenshots attached). I've attached screenshots before and after Clearcoat was enabled with the Toon Specular Mode. I've also attached the console output that appeared immediately after enabling Clearcoat.

BEFORE
![screenshot-20170929-07 08 07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1168026/31019953-4ea8cad8-a4e6-11e7-8838-08f29f234ef0.png)

AFTER
![screenshot-20170929-07 08 12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1168026/31019956-51a93182-a4e6-11e7-8343-53028b68fa1e.png)

[toon-clearcoat-bug-log.txt](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1344669/toon-clearcoat-bug-log.txt)

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Create new scene
- Add Spatial node
- Add MeshInstance
- Change Mesh property to New SphereMesh
- Add SpatialMaterial to mesh
- Change material Specular Mode to Toon
- Enable material Clearcoat

**Link to minimal example project:**
[toon-clearcoat-bug.tscn.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1344632/toon-clearcoat-bug.tscn.zip)

data.title: Godot 2D/3D preference on node searching
data.body:
Any device probably, version 2.1.4.

Issue: When I'm using Godot to make 2D games, and I want to for example put a 2D node like RigidBody2D, I type rigidbody and always the 3D node comes for the first choice, that's for every node that have an equal on 2D.
That's not a big issue, just usability.
Solutions that I think:
1- When you choose a 2D node, change the search to a 2D preference;
2- Make so that you can get the 3D nodes disappear;
3- When creating a project you could make a selection between a 2D or 3D project.
4- When using the 2D tab and add a node, it comes to preference 2D nodes when searching.

data.title: Crash when activating/disabling CollisionShape2D in various cases
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 3.0, recent Calinou build from 27/09

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Using move_and_slide on a KinematicBody2D in combination with disabling a CollisionShape2D and enabling another crashes when the KinematicBody2D hits the a surface.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Put KinematicBody2D in a scene, give it two CollisionShape2D capsule shapes.
2. Use move_and_slide to move it down towards a static collider.
3. Click a button to disable the first collider and activate the other. It crashes when there is collision.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
Use button 'space' to activate/disable the colliders.
[Crash with colliders.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1344432/Crash.with.colliders.zip)

data.title: Hovering over drop menus after clicking should open them
data.body:
When the user is searching for an entry its cumbersome to click every time to open the drop menu.
I think it would be better if every menu opens upon hovering after one was clicked.
This behavior is seen in Godot 2.1 and 3.0

Here is a comparison with blender:
![im_color_dither_32_ezgif-1-4e9083bfdd](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13117706/31016318-79f2f608-a524-11e7-886f-794b9f073a14.gif)

edit: This issue could be related: #10911

data.title: Support for #include in shaders
data.body:
In Godot 3.0

It would be useful to have #include functionnality in shaders for easy re-use of functions (I found this: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/4505 but it only concerns built-in shaders).
I'm pretty sure this was suggested at some point when discussing on the new shader langage, but I could't find an issue about it.

s in GGX.

data.title: [WIP] Made a few tweaks to the ARVR interface
data.body:
Made a few small tweaks to the arvr interface.

I've removed a few functions that have been there since the start but we've never really used them and they didn't really do anything.

I've also added a few things based on the ARKit interface. I'm sure this will grow as time goes on but the more we can capture in the base interface the easier implementing solutions will be.

Obviously once merged I'll need to update all the interface to follow suit.

data.title: Anisotropy direction
data.body: Current implementation treats allow anisotropy along with x or y axis only, and furthermore treats x and y axis differently. Adding a rotation angle parameter would solve both issues.

data.title: Materials look very different in Godot compared to Substance Designer
data.body:
![Rendering in Godot 3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/180032/31014300-6c28a194-a51a-11e7-8cfa-0d4cd52b5cdd.png)

The rendering looks much more "bland" in Godot compared to Substance Designer. (Disregard the lack of depth, it doesn't work well with CubeMeshes.)

![Rendering in the Substance viewport](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/180032/31014213-0a803632-a51a-11e7-9274-571e3f3044c5.png)

**Link to minimal example project:** [yamt.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1344141/yamt.zip)

data.title: Vertical alignement (TabContainer menu button)
data.body: The dots are in the centre (vertically) of the tabs section. fixes issue brought up by @puppetmaster- in #11660

data.title: TCP_Server has no function "listen"
data.body:
2.1.4 branch

**Issue description:**
Trying to use the TCP_Server class only to find out there is an error trying to access the function `listen`. It has to do with the GDNativeBase Class not having the listen function or something.

`Invalid call. Nonexistent function 'listen' in base 'GDNativeClass'.`

**Steps to reproduce:**

Try to listen using a TCP_Server, do you get a different outcome?

I know this will may not get attention because of new multiplayer stuff, but if its just a GDNative acess error, would someone be able to help me?
